intro: Leuranthus woodianus, commonly known as the golden flame orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in clusters and are known for their striking color and long-lasting display.
